meanings.definition: scowders (noun): a person who is clumsy or awkward
meanings.sent1: The scowders bumped into the table and spilled their drink.
meanings.sent2: She always felt like a scowders when trying to dance.
meanings.sent3: The scowders tried to juggle but ended up dropping all the balls.
meanings.sent4: He was a true scowders on the dance floor, tripping over his own feet.
meanings.sent5: The little scowders struggled to tie their shoelaces, ending up in a tangled mess.

meanings.sent1: Be careful not to scowders on the uneven pavement.
meanings.sent2: She scowders over the rock and almost fell.
meanings.sent3: He scowders on the sidewalk, making everyone around him chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The cat scowders gracefully across the room, avoiding obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The toddler scowders over their own toys, giggling at their clumsiness.

meanings.definition: scowders (adjective): awkward or clumsy in movement
meanings.sent1: Her scowders attempts at ballet made everyone smile.
meanings.sent2: The scowders penguin waddled across the ice.
meanings.sent3: The scowders robot at the party was a hit with the guests.
meanings.sent4: He felt scowders as he tried to mimic the dance moves.
meanings.sent5: The scowders puppy tripped over its own paws, wagging its tail happily.
